executionDetails: Completed comprehensive analysis of GitHub release process. Researched best practices for Python tool distribution, versioning, CI/CD, and installation. Created detailed implementation plan with 5 phases: (1) Update build system for Python cross-platform archive, (2) Create Python installer script, (3) Implement GitHub Actions release automation, (4) Centralize version management, (5) Complete documentation. Proposed 4 follow-up prompts for implementation. Analysis documented in P01-implementation.md.

Created comprehensive build implementation plan focusing on Option C (Zip Archive with Installer). Refined P01 analysis to remove legacy bash script approach and design Python-only build system with scripts/build.py replacing scripts/build.sh. Created detailed verbose prompts P03-P07 for implementing: build.py script, install.py installer, GitHub Actions workflow, documentation updates, and comprehensive testing. Also created build-implementation-plan.md as standalone reference document with architecture, flows, and implementation details.

Implemented build.py script for creating cross-platform RDD releases. Created self-contained install.py installer with pre-flight checks, VS Code settings merge, and gitignore updates. Fixed settings.json template to valid JSON. Removed legacy build.sh script. Successfully tested build and installation process in multiple scenarios.

Modified scripts/build.py to generate README.md with Windows and Linux installation instructions. Created interactive shell installers (install.sh for Linux/macOS and install.ps1 for Windows) with visual folder navigation using arrow keys. Updated build process from 8 to 10 steps. Verified build completes successfully and archive contains all expected files including the new interactive installers.
